alert.note: Alert for Barnstable; Central Middlesex County; Eastern Essex; Eastern Norfolk; Eastern Plymouth; Northern Bristol; Southeast Middlesex; Southern Bristol; Southern Plymouth; Southern Worcester; Suffolk; Western Essex; Western Norfolk; Western Plymouth (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 22 at 8:50AM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A LINE OF STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL CROSS RHODE ISLAND AND EASTERN MASSACHUSETTS THIS MORNING... At 849 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from northeast Connecticut into central and northeast Massachusetts. Movement was east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Minor flooding and possibly wind gusts to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor nuisance flooding of typically flood prone areas. Strong winds may cause minor damage such as downed branches. Locations impacted include... Boston, Providence, Cambridge, New Bedford, Brockton, Quincy, Lynn, Fall River, Newton, Warwick, Cranston, Lawrence, Somerville, Pawtucket, Framingham, Haverhill, Waltham, Malden, Brookline and Plymouth. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. Do not drive through flooded roads or underpasses. Avoid low lying areas near small streams.
